page.title: 04TRANSPORT AROUND CUMBERNAULD
page.content: Due to its position midway between { {Glasgow}and{Stirling, Cumbernauld }was well placed on the main communications link from west to east. Road links were opened in the 18th century and extended south to{Airdrie} and on to{Carlisle. The {Forth and Clyde canal}runs close to the town and once helped its industry by giving access to both coasts. The opening of the{railways}spelt the end of the canal and coach service but the town was well placed to take advantage of the easier communications offered. The choice of{Cumbernauld }as a centre for a {New Town}owed much to this ease of {Communication,}and the growth of the town since 1956 has been rapid and continuous.
